title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A gripping, heart-wrenching, and wholly remarkable tale of coming-of-age in a South poisoned by virulent prejudice.

author: George Orwell
description: Orwell's dystopian vision of a government that will do anything to control the narrative.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A portrait of the Jazz Age in all of its decadence and excess, Gatsby captured the spirit of the author's generation.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: Austen's tale of love and economics reaches us with a clarity that is undiminished by the two centuries since its publication.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A world-weary, ancient child of sixteen, who was uncomprehendingly expelled from academic paradise.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit enjoying his quiet life, is swept into an epic quest by Gandalf the Grey and thirteen dwarves who seek to reclaim their mountain home from Smaug, the dragon.

title: Moby Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: Captain Ahab's obsessive quest for the white whale is a multifaceted masterwork.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
description: Harry Potter has been living an ordinary life, constantly abused by his aunt and uncle, but he is whisked away to a world of magic and fantasy.

title: The Diary of a Young Girl
author: Anne Frank
description: The story of Anne Frank, a Jewish victim of the Holocaust, through her own poignant words.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A sweeping narrative of the tumultuous era that was the Napoleonic Age.

title: The Book Thief
author: Markus Zusak
description: A story narrated by Death, it's about a young girl's relationship with her foster parents, the other residents of their neighborhood, and a Jewish fist-fighter.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: An epic fantasy of the endless quest of the Fellowship of the Ring, and one of the greatest stories ever told.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: The mystical story of Santiago, an Andalusian shepherd boy who yearns to travel in search of a worldly treasure.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
description: A dystopian future where literature is on the brink of extinction.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte BrontÃ«
description: The struggles of Jane Eyre, an orphaned young woman, to maintain her dignity through periods of hardship.

title: Animal Farm
author: George Orwell
description: A farm's revolt against their human master by the animals who wanted equality but the pigs take over.

title: Gone with the Wind
author: Margaret Mitchell
description: A tale of war and passion, following the life of Scarlett O'Hara during and after the Civil War.

title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
author: Mark Twain
description: The story of Huck Finn and his companion, the slave Jim, as they journey down the Mississippi River.

title: The Grapes of Wrath
author: John Steinbeck
description: The epic tale of the Joad family's migration from the Dust Bowl of Oklahoma to California in search of a better life.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A chilling dystopian tale of the foresight of social control, through the diminishment of individuality.
